description: From Old Norse gaupn (“hollow made by cupped hands”).  Doublet of yepsen.

entries.meaning: (chiefly Scotland) A bowl made of the two hands cupped together.
examples: it was ordered by Marina, who had it framed and set up in her bedroom next to a picture of her brother at twelve or fourteen clad in a bayronka (open shirt) and cupping a guinea pig in his gowpen (hollowed hands)  […]
